# accessibilityLabel()

**Instance Method**

Returns a short description of the stepper.

## Declaration

```swift
func accessibilityLabel() -> String?
```

## Return Value

The description of the stepper.

## Discussion

This method is the getter for the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityProtocol] protocol’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-c.protocol/accessibilityLabel] property.

Do not include the control’s type in the label (for example, use `Volume`, not `Volume stepper`). If possible use a single word. To help ensure that accessibility clients such as VoiceOver read the label with the correct intonation, start this label with a capital letter. Do not put a period at the end. Always localize the label.

## Supporting Accessibility

- **accessibilityPerformDecrement()**: Decrements the stepper’s value.
- **accessibilityPerformIncrement()**: Increments the stepper’s value.
- **accessibilityValue()**: Returns the stepper’s value.
